data.name: AssemblyDescription
data.value: The assembly to use.

data.name: AutomaticMigrationDisabledInfo
data.value: You can use the Add-Migration command to write the pending model changes to a code-based migration.

data.name: ConfigDescription
data.value: Specifies the configuration file to use for named connection strings.

data.name: ConnectionProviderDescription
data.value: Specifies the provider invariant name of the connection string.

data.name: ConnectionStringDescription
data.value: Specifies the connection string to use. If omitted, the context's default connection will be used.

data.name: ConnectionStringNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of a connection string to use from the application's configuration file.

data.name: ContextAssemblyDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the assembly which contains the DbContext class to use. If omitted, the context is assumed to be in the same assembly used for migrations.

data.name: ContextDescription
data.value: Specifies the context to use. If omitted, migrations will attempt to locate a single context type in the target project.

data.name: DatabaseDescription
data.value: Commands to manage the database.

data.name: DatabaseUpdateDescription
data.value: Applies any pending migrations to the database.

data.name: DatabaseUpdateForceDescription
data.value: Specifies that data loss is acceptable during automatic migration of the database.

data.name: DatabaseUpdateScriptDescription
data.value: Generate a SQL script rather than executing the pending changes directly.

data.name: DatabaseUpdateSourceDescription
data.value: Only valid with --script. Specifies the name of a particular migration to use as the update's starting point. If omitted, the last applied migration in the database will be used.

data.name: DatabaseUpdateTargetDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of a particular migration to update the database to. If omitted, the current model will be used.

data.name: DataDirDescription
data.value: The data directory.

data.name: DidYouMeanToRescaffold
data.value: A previous migration called '{0}' was already applied to the target database. If you meant to re-scaffold '{0}', revert it by running 'Update-Database -TargetMigration {1}', then delete '{2}' and run 'Add-Migration {0}' again.

data.name: EF6FullName
data.value: Entity Framework Command-line Tools

data.name: EnableMigrations_BeginInitialScaffold
data.value: Checking if the context targets an existing database...

data.name: EnableMigrations_InitialScaffold
data.value: Detected database created with a database initializer. Scaffolded migration '{0}' corresponding to existing database. To use an automatic migration instead, delete the Migrations folder and re-run Enable-Migrations specifying the -EnableAutomaticMigrations parameter.

data.name: EnableMigrations_Success
data.value: Code First Migrations enabled for project {0}.

data.name: EntityFrameworkNotFound
data.value: Your target project '{0}' doesn't reference EntityFramework. This package is required for the Entity Framework Core Tools to work. Ensure your target project is correct, install the package, and try again.

data.name: GetMigrationsCommand_Intro
data.value: Retrieving migrations that have been applied to the target database.

data.name: GetMigrationsCommand_NoHistory
data.value: No migrations have been applied to the target database.

data.name: IgnoreChangesDescription
data.value: Scaffolds an empty migration ignoring any pending changes detected in the current model. This can be used to create an initial, empty migration to enable Migrations for an existing database. N.B. Doing this assumes that the target database schema is compatible with the current model.

data.name: JsonDescription
data.value: Show JSON output.

data.name: LanguageDescription
data.value: The language. Defaults to 'C#'.

data.name: MigrationNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the custom script.

data.name: MigrationsAddDescription
data.value: Scaffolds a migration script for any pending model changes.

data.name: MigrationsAddForceDescription
data.value: Specifies that the migration user code be overwritten when re-scaffolding an existing migration.

data.name: MigrationsAlreadyEnabled
data.value: Migrations have already been enabled in project '{0}'. To overwrite the existing migrations configuration, use the -Force parameter.

data.name: MigrationsConfigDescription
data.value: Specifies the migrations configuration to use. If omitted, migrations will attempt to locate a single migrations configuration type in the target project.

data.name: MigrationsDescription
data.value: Commands to manage migrations.

data.name: MigrationsDirDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the directory that will contain migrations code files. If omitted, the directory will be named "Migrations".

data.name: MigrationsDirectoryParamIsRooted
data.value: The 'MigrationsDirectory' parameter was set to the absolute path '{0}'. The migrations directory must be set to a relative path for a sub-directory under the Visual Studio project root.

data.name: MigrationsEnableAutoDescription
data.value: Specifies whether automatic migrations will be enabled in the scaffolded migrations configuration. If omitted, automatic migrations will be disabled.

data.name: MigrationsEnableDescription
data.value: Enables Code First Migrations in a project.

data.name: MigrationsEnableForceDescription
data.value: Specifies that the migrations configuration be overwritten when running more than once for a given project.

data.name: MigrationsListDescription
data.value: Displays the migrations that have been applied to the target database.

data.name: MissingArgument
data.value: Missing required argument '{0}'.

data.name: MissingOption
data.value: Missing required option '--{0}'.

data.name: MutuallyExclusiveOptions
data.value: Specify either option '--{0}' or '--{2}', but not both.

data.name: NoColorDescription
data.value: Don't colorize output.

data.name: PrefixDescription
data.value: Prefix output with level.

data.name: ProjectDirDescription
data.value: The project directory. Defaults to the current directory.

data.name: RescaffoldingMigration
data.value: Re-scaffolding migration '{0}'.

data.name: RescaffoldNoForce
data.value: Only the Designer Code for migration '{0}' was re-scaffolded. To re-scaffold the entire migration, use the -Force parameter.

data.name: RootNamespaceDescription
data.value: The root namespace. Defaults to the target assembly name.

data.name: ScaffoldingMigration
data.value: Scaffolding migration '{0}'.

data.name: SnapshotBehindWarning
data.value: The Designer Code for this migration file includes a snapshot of your current Code First model. This snapshot is used to calculate the changes to your model when you scaffold the next migration. If you make additional changes to your model that you want to include in this migration, then you can re-scaffold it by running 'Add-Migration {0}' again.

data.name: UpdateDatabaseCommand_VerboseInstructions
data.value: Specify the '-Verbose' flag to view the SQL statements being applied to the target database.

data.name: VerboseDescription
data.value: Show verbose output.
